author: killari.
content: what are `totalDifficulty` and `difficulty` of a block going to represent post merge?

author: sky.cactus
content: `totalDifficulty` I guess will just stagnate at the `totalDifficulty` of the last block?  Maybe some clients will remove it from the JSON-RPC response?  We historically have been pretty bad about defining JSON-RPC behavior with hard forks that change them.  ðŸ˜–

author: killari.
content: is there a spec for JSON-RPC post merge?

author: sky.cactus
content: There is no spec for JSON-RPC pre-merge.  ðŸ˜¬

author: sky.cactus
content: Well, there is a bunch of partial ones, but all of them are incomplete.

author: sky.cactus
content: As far as consensus behavior, see this: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3675#block-structure

author: sky.cactus
content: That defines ommersHash (uncleHash), difficulty, mixHash, nonce, and ommers (uncles) in consensus data structures post merge.

author: killari.
content: I have considered that this is the spec: <https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/>

author: sky.cactus
content: Also note https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4399#block-structure which defines the field previously called `mixHash` as RANDAO in the block header.
